content: in this legal case two parties were involved in a dispute over the division of joint property specifically a condominium the claimant wanted to sell the property at a public auction and split the proceeds while the defendant wanted exclusive ownership of the property the court ultimately granted the defendants claim and ordered the deletion of the claimants entry in the land register the court also determined the market value of the property to be €199633 the parties also had a loan agreement for the property and the court determined that the outstanding loan amount should be borne by the defendant the defendant argued that the claimant should also contribute to the loan repayment but the court disagreed the court also considered other payments made by the defendant towards joint obligations and ordered the claimant to compensate the defendant for half of those payments the claimant requested compensation for a deposit made for a disputed apartment but the court found that the evidence provided did not prove the payment towards separate property the court concluded that the circumstances did not justify a departure from the principle of equal division of property there was also a dispute over a car that was transferred without consent the court determined the value of the car to be €20000 and awarded the defendant €10000 in compensation the court ordered the defendant to pay the claimant €4268417 for the loss of property and €2863676 for other claims the court also discussed the distribution of procedural costs determining that each party should bear their own costs overall the court made decisions regarding the division of joint property loan repayment compensation for payments made and procedural costs
